keyTakeAways: Terrassa, a town in Catalonia, Spain, has implemented a temporary ban on black cat adoptions from shelters during Halloween to prevent potential ritualistic harm.
The ban runs from 6 October to 10 November, with exceptions assessed individually by the adoption center.
The local animal welfare service cites increased adoption requests during Halloween and past incidents of cruelty as key reasons for the policy.
While black cats are associated with witchcraft in Western culture, other cultures like Japan and Egypt view them as symbols of prosperity.
Terrassa has more than 9,800 cats, with 12 black cats in the adoption center, and the ban is described as temporary and exceptional but may be repeated in the future.
The decision reflects a precautionary approach to animal welfare in response to cultural superstitions and reported incidents of abuse.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Spanish town of Terrassa in Catalonia has temporarily banned the adoption of black cats from animal shelters from 6 October to 10 November to prevent Halloween-related rituals and potential harm. The ban, led by Deputy Mayor Noel Duque and communicated through RTVE, is based on increased adoption requests during Halloween and past reports of cruelty. While black cats are traditionally linked to witchcraft in Western cultures, other cultures like Japan and Egypt view them as symbols of good fortune. Terrassa, home to over 9,800 cats and 12 black cats in its adoption center, implemented the measure as a precautionary, temporary, and exceptional step to protect animal welfare, with exceptions evaluated individually and normal adoption resuming after the period.
title: Terrassa: Catalonian town bans black cat adoptions during Halloween
